Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Rev. Yaniris Gomez, Warden at Holy Rood Church Ingelesia Santa Church located at 715 West 179th Street, New York, NY 10033.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member De La Rosa.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Interfaith Minister.Yaniris Urbaez, Warden at Holyrood Church/ Iglesia de Santa Church located at 715 West 179th Street, New York, N.Y 10033.

Council Member De La Rosa moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Quarterly reporting requirements on visitations of incarcerated individuals and requiring the DOC to record notifications to incarcerated individuals of visitation requests.

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Governmental Operations, State & Federal Legislation
Items.AgendaNote: REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON GOVERNMENTAL OPERATIONS, STATE & FEDERAL LEGISLATION

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.2082/A.3474 to create the New York State Working Families Tax Credit.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Create the New York State Working Families Tax Credit (S.2082/A.3474).

Items.Title: Resolution calling on New York state to create a program to provide food benefits for those not eligible for existing benefits, including anyone over 55 meeting income eligibility.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 7 Council Members formally noted their intent to vote negative against this item:

Council Members Carr, Holden, Marmorato, Paladino, Vernikov, Zhuang and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Create a program to provide food benefits for those not eligible for existing benefits, including anyone over 55 meeting income eligibility.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Immigration
Items.AgendaNote: REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON IMMIGRATION

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to enhancing the application process for the New York city identity card
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Enhancing the application process for the New York city identity card.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to reintroduce and pass, and the Governor to sign A.3506/S.2235, also known as the New York for All Act, which would prohibit and regulate the discovery and disclosure of immigration status by New York state and local government entities.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 7 Council Members formally noted their intent to vote negative against this item:

Council Members Carr, Gennaro, Holden, Marmorato, Paladino, Vernikov and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).

The following Council Member formally noted her intent to abstain from voting on this item:  
Council Member Zhuang.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: New York for All Act (A.3506/S.2235).

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.270/S.141, also known as the Access to Representation Act, which establishes the right to legal counsel in immigration court proceedings and provides for the administration thereof.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 6 Council Members formally noted their intent to vote in the negative against this item:: 
Council Members Carr, Holden, Marmorato, Paladino, Vernikov and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Access to Representation Act, which establishes the right to legal counsel in immigration court proceedings and provides for the administration thereof (A.270/S.141).

Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Eliminate the rule that provides whenever a city charter commission puts a proposal on the local ballot, other referendum proposals are barred from the ballot (S.590/A.3665).

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Pursuant to Section 33-a of the New York City Charter, the New York City Council may vote on the following items no earlier than 30 days from the date of this notice. The New York City Council reserves the right to vote without the notice required pursuant to Section 33-a on any proposed local laws that do not relate to the public safety operations of the New York City Police Department, the Fire Department or the Department of Correction.
Items.AgendaNote: INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS - Pursuant to Section 33-a of the New York City Charter, the New York City Council may vote on the following items no earlier than 30 days from the date of this notice. The New York City Council reserves the right to vote without the notice required pursuant to Section 33-a on any proposed local laws that do not relate to the public safety operations of the New York City Police Department, the Fire Department or the Department of Correction.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating an archive of official government social media accounts

Items.Title: Children and Youth

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the administration for children’s services to report annually on the number and placement of foster youth
Items.MatterName: Requiring the administration for children’s services to report annually on the number and placement of foster youth.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring an audit and report on foster care placement notices
Items.MatterName: Requiring an audit and report on foster care placement notices.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to expanding foster youth experience surveys to include experiences related to gender expression, gender identity, sex characteristics, and sexual orientation
Items.MatterName: Expanding foster youth experience surveys to include experiences related to gender expression, gender identity, sex characteristics, and sexual orientation.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Farías) presiding as the President Pro Tempore.

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías).

There were 46 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.

There are presently two vacant seats on the Council (44th CD, Brooklyn and 51st CD, Staten Island).
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Adams) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Wednesday, March 26, 2025.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int. No. 216-A,  VOTE: 39-7-0
Negative: Carr, Gennaro, Holden, Marmorato, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).

L.U. No. 241 & Res. No. 808,  VOTE for Disapproval: 45-0-1
Abstain: Council Member Menin.

L.U. No. 249 & Res. No. 811,  VOTE: 41-2-3
Negative: Council Member Paladino and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola);
Abstain: Council Members Cabán, Marte, and Sanchez.

L.U. No. 250 & Res. No. 812,  VOTE: 41-2-3
Negative: Council Member Paladino and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola);
Abstain: Council Members Cabán, Marte, and Sanchez.

See files for individual votes.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
